channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024101527
item.description:
Report X-2024101527

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-27T18:24:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-21
  • City: BATTLE CREEK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be leaking once the delivery truck got back to the building. Liquid was leaking from the closure but could not tell what exactly happened. Package was placed in a red hazmat tote so it could be transported to the hazmat cage for further investigation. Upon closer inspection, I could not tell where from the closure it was leaking from.

item.title: Report X-2024101510
item.description:
Report X-2024101510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-25T09:22:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: WYOMING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED OF LEAKING HAZMAT. ALL EMPOYEES LEFT THE AREA UNTIL REPSONDER SHOWED UP. RESPONDER CORDONED OFF THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND. CHAIN OF COMMAND NOTIFIED THE ENVIRONMENTAL COORDINATOR WHO THEN INSTRUCTED THE RESPONDER TO PERFORM A IN HOUSE CLEAN UP.
